meanings.definition: The state or quality of being easily seen or noticed.
meanings.sent1: The bright color of the fire truck increased its conspicuity on the road.
meanings.sent2: The reflective stripes on the cyclist's jacket improved his conspicuity during the night.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's attempt to hide in the open field failed miserably due to its high conspicuity.
meanings.sent4: The new billboard had such high conspicuity that it drew everyone's attention instantly.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse's beam of light provided great conspicuity for ships navigating the dark waters.

meanings.definition: The degree to which an object stands out from its surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The neon sign's high conspicuity made it easy to spot from far away.
meanings.sent2: The zebra's stripes help increase its conspicuity in the tall grass.
meanings.sent3: The clown's outfit had such high conspicuity that it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The lone tree's conspicuity in the vast desert was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The singer's unique voice added to the band's conspicuity during the performance.
